summary: An Ordinance accepting the bid of the State of Washington, by and through its Board of Finance, for negotiable bonds of The City of Seattle, in the sum of Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($500,000), of bonds in the sum of One Million Eighty Thousand Dollars ($1,080,000), authorized by Ordinance No. 23220 of The City of Seattle, approved February 1, 1910, and voted at the general election held in said city on Tuesday, March 8th, 1910, under and pursuant to said ordinance, and declaring an emergency.
